response:
Among the ages, in terms of a person who brushes their teeth, my final answer is:

Teen (13-19 years old)

The teenage years are a critical period for oral health, as this is when the permanent teeth are fully developed and the teeth are most susceptible to decay. Brushing teeth regularly is an essential habit to develop during this age group, as it helps to remove plaque and food particles that can cause tooth decay. Additionally, teenagers are more likely to have a consistent dental routine, as they are more likely to be motivated to take care of their teeth due to social and peer pressure.

While other ages may also prioritize their oral health, the age range of "adult" is most likely to excel at brushing their teeth due to these factors.
